oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lieut. John Philip Sousa and his Band, 1922
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An advertising announcement for a performance by Lieut. John Philip Sousa and his band on October 27, 1922, at the Ryman Auditorium, located on Fifth Avenue North in downtown Nashville. Sousa was an American composer and conductor known particularly for American military marches. Because of his influence in this genre, he is known as "The March King." Forms part of the Naff Collection. 1 advertising announcement : b & w ; 9 x 12.5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sousa, John Philip, 1854-1932
Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Sousa Band
